result.execSummary:
The defendant KYLE J JOHNSON was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-No Contact with the victim, victim's family or residence. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. 
-No Contact with any minors without approval of the agent and the agent can set up appropriate restrictions.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment and follow-up as recommended.  
-Mental Health Assessment.
-Sex Offender Treatment.
-Sex Offender Registry for life.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

-To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the first year of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. KYLE J JOHNSON

defendant.name: JOHNSON, KYLE J
defendant.address: 125 N GRAND STREET PO BOX 197, MARKESAN, WI 53946

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
2:06 PM Defendant KYLE J JOHNSON in court.  Attorney Jacquelyn Wolter in court for KYLE J JOHNSON.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Wolter confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Atty Wolter confirms the defendant will waive the preliminary. Court instructs the defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court, same as the criminal complaint and copy to Atty Wolter. Attorney Wolter acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Wolter enters a plea of No CONTEST on behalf of the defendant.

Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to the charge with probation and conditions. DA concurs. Atty Wolter concurs. Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty as charged. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Both counsel are waiving right to a presentence investigation. DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights. Sentencing statement by DA Laspisa. Sentencing statement by Atty Wolter. No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 5 years.

CONDITIONS:

-No Contact with the victim, victim's family or residence.
-No Contact with any minors without approval of the agent and the agent can set up appropriate restrictions.
-Court costs. To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid within the first year of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment and follow-up as recommended.  
-AODA and any follow-up. 
-Mental Health Assessment.
-Sex Offender Treatment.
-Sex Offender Registry for life.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

+Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. 

Court adjourned at 2:31 PM

Payable Number: 69465,
Receipt Number: 22R 003782,
Amount: $20.00
